project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When creating a series of cards in a row (clicking new card, then creating with the 'Create' button rather than 'Create and Close'), it's frustrating that GH doesn't remember the assignee I chose for the previous card in the series. I'm creating cards in a specific component of a project, and the assignee is chosen automatically. This makes sense for the first card I create, but after that it becomes tedious to change the assignee each time.

My particular use case is creating personal to-do list items that need to be assigned to me.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper user who creates series of cards at a time, I want the dialog to remember the assignee

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We will be creating JIRA v5.0-m2 on Tuesday afternoon
Please release a GH milestone that is compiled against JIRA 5.0-alpha3
fields.summary: Please release a version of GH that we can ship with jira v5.0-m2

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The overall story cannot be placed on top of its subtasks. The planning board thinks that an unrelated issue is the overall story for the subtasks.
fields.summary: Subtasks are separated from overall story in Planning Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be useful if I could lock a version once it has started so that no one can add tickets into that version (except me).  This would help me police against those who add work to the current sprint accidentally or not.  Often people unknowingly drop tickets into the current sprint, and right now the only way to stop this is to be vigilant about checking email notifications.
fields.summary: As a Project Lead I would like to be able to Lock down a version after a sprint has started so that others cannot add additional work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Right now, when you set up a visual indicator in the statistics, the bar only shows once.  I would like it to show every X so that you can see forward better.

For example:  Lets say I have set the Story Points Max value at 25.  I would like to see a Black bar every 25 points when looking at my backlog, so that I can see how far away a specific story is, given the current ranking and pointing.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like the statistics bar to repeat so that I can see 2 to 3 sprints ahead when doing release planning

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Portlets have been removed from JIRA v5.
As part of this, JIRA v5.0 will only allow users to upgrade from v4.0 or higher.

This means that GhUpgradeTask001 which updates Legacy Portlets to Google Gadgets will no longer compile, but it not required any more either.
fields.summary: GhUpgradeTask001 should be removed in the JIRA 5 compatible branch because Legacy Portlets have been removed from JIRA v5.0

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The fact that the Rapid Board allows configurable views is a fantastic idea since each user can show exactly the issues they want to see.  Unfortunately, it also severely limits the ability for multiple users to use a single GreenHopper instance (as currently implemented) since each user will have their own opinion about how issues appearing in different Rapid Board views should be ranked relative to another user's preferred rankings in their own Rapid Board view.  Changes made in one Rapid Board view's issue ranking based on one criteria will rearrange issues in another Rapid Board view that are ranked based on differing criteria.

Users need to be able to create and share ranking contexts so that the actions of one individual changing ranking orders does not affect another user's preferred rankings.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I need to be able to see issues ordered based on a selectable ranking context

fields.description: There is currently an hour burndown chart and a statistics burndown chart but there is no wallboard capable issue burndown chart. I would like to have an easy to implement issue burndown chart for a wallboard. On my desktop monitors & dashboards, the agile gadget is fine for what I need. But for larger displays & wallboards an issue burndown is a requirement for me. Pretty please?

fields.description: I have found that the days remaining wallboard gadget uses excessive vertical space which causes you to be able to put fewer items on your wallboard. See attachment where there is approx 180px of empty space between the days remaining gadget and the activity stream gadget. It seems like 75px would be more than sufficient.
fields.summary: Days remaining wallboard gadget uses excessive vertical space

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When I choose a wallboard capable gadget and it has any links, it renders them as blue on black, which are nearly unreadable

Here's the offending style block
{code}a:link,a:visited{color:#036;}a:hover,a:active{color:#369;}a:hover{text-decoration:none;}table{border-collapse:collapse;}.view .results-count a,.view .table-footer a{text-decoration:underline;}.view a,.view a:link,.view a:visited{color:#036;text-decoration:none;}.view a:hover,.view a:active{color:#369;text-decoration:underline;}{code}

Our reference to that css file is: http://tickets.turner.com/s/615/3/3.0.2/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite/com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.css

attaching screenshot of a link on the wallboard in my browser (mac: snow leopard, firefox 3.x)
fields.summary: Links on wallboard gadgets unreadable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, if I set a sprint's start date and create issues on that date, then the red guideline would take the total original estimate from all these issues and plot the chart.

However, if I add more issues after the sprint's start date, the red guideline would not change to reflect this; however, the green one does.

Is there any where to make the red guideline be dynamic?
fields.summary: When I Add New Issues to a Sprint, I Would Like the Red Guideline to be Dynamically Changing

fields.description:
GH's AbstractBoardAction extends JIRA's AbstractIssueSelectAction, which is a bad idea.

AbstractIssueSelectAction underwent major change in v4.4.1

The fastest/safest fix would be for GH to copy/paste the AbstractIssueSelectAction code from either JIRA v4.4.0 or v4.3.x
fields.summary: AbstractBoardAction will fail to compile under JIRA v4.4.1 and v5.0

fields.description:

1. Project A - Created a new Epic using the "New Card".
2. Project B - Opened an existing Story and opened the Epic/Theme field. The epic that I had created in project A can be selected. 

The Epic/theme should only visible by their own project while user select. This might breaks privacy policy for some customer.

fields.description:
Hi,

We are working with two week iterations/sprints and recently created dashboards with the Agile Gadget and people couldn't understand when they created filter-based Agile gadgets they had to set the start and end dates manually when the filter was something like 'sprint bugs' or 'sprint technical tasks'.

Kolos

fields.description:
Hello.

On Greenhopper, when looking at the Planning board, if there is an parent issue that is blocked, there will be a small yellow sign saying so. However subtasks have no such sign, making very hard for users, in this screen, to differentiate blocked issues from non-blocked issues. Currently, the only way is to go inside the issues in JIRA and see if they are blocked or not.

Are there any plans to fix/implement this behaviour?

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support

fields.description:
The 'Time Estimate' and 'Time Remaining' values on the Planning Board's Statistic column (for a given child or parent version of a JIRA project), are correct. These values correspond to the 'Remaining Values' (i.e. Remaining Hours on the green curve) for the respective start and end dates on the Hour Burndown Chart (of the same child/parent version of that JIRA project).

However, *the Agile Gadget's 'Info' tab reports different 'Time Estimate' and 'Time Remaining' values* to GH's Planning Board statistics (for the same project and child/parent version above), whereas the chart on the 'Hours' tab is exactly the same as GH's Hour Burndown chart.

Since the Agile Gadget can access GH's Remaining Hours values on the 'Hours' tab, please fix the 'Info' tab so that its 'Time Estimate' and 'Time Remaining' values match those on the Statistics column of GH's Planning Board.

(See [Sprint Planning and Initial Number of Hours|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Sprint+Hour+Burndown+Charts#SprintHourBurndownCharts-sprintplanning] for details on how the initial 'Time Estimate' value is calculated. Be aware that the bold *Remaining Estimate* terms on this page relate to the 'Remaining Estimate' field on the history tab of a JIRA issue.)
fields.summary: The Agile Gadget's 'Info' tab reports 'Time Estimate' and 'Time Remaining' values inconsistently from GreenHopper's Planning and Chart Board Statistics.

fields.description:
Move the GreenHopper developer documentation into a separate space on CAC. 
* Part of project Spiderweb. See [Spiderweb tech writing tasks|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/Spiderweb+technical+writing+tasks+June-July+2011].
* Something we've been planning for a long time, since we did the FECRUDEV and CONFDEV spaces in 2009.

Instructions on how to do it: See [EAC|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/How+to+migrate+developer+documentation+to+a+new+space].

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Discuss with GreenHopper PM, dev lead and tech writer.
_Mon 27 June 2011:_ Agreement from Paul Slade, Nick Muldoon and Giles Gaskell.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Add version tables and apply changes to API docs from GreenHopper 5.3 to 5.6.
_Tues 5 July:_ Checked the versions of the two existing pages. There are no changes since the pages were created in September 2010. Added the version table to the single module.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Create new space on CAC.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Delete home page of new space, and fix permissions.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Move dev hub to new space.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Add links from GH product docs to new space.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Prettify the home page of the new space.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Update GH053, GH054 and GH055 to point to the new dev space too.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Let the GH team know it's done.
Sent email and write blog post. 
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/2011/07/06/GreenHopper+developer+docs+moved+to+GHDEV+space
fields.summary: Move the GreenHopper developer documentation into a separate space on CAC

fields.description:

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to replicate the problem:

*Default Assignee to Project Lead*
* Create a project with the default assignee as *Project Lead*
* Create a new card and type other username (not the Project Lead) for the assignee
* The assignee will be assigned to the Project Lead instead of the username which has been filled up in the *Assignee* field.

*Default Assignee to Unassigned*
* Create a project with the default assignee as *Unassigned*
* Create a new card and type other username for the assignee
* The assignee will be set to *Unassigned* instead of the username which has been filled up in the *Assignee* field.

*Default Assignee to the Component Lead for the Specific Component*
* Create a component in the project and set the default assignee as *Component Lead* for that component.
* Create a new card and type other username (not the Component Lead) for the assignee
* Choose the specific component that you had created for the project.
* The assignee will be set to the Component Lead instead of the username which has been filled up in the *Assignee* field.
fields.summary: Wrong Assignee When Creating A New Card

fields.description:
Use case:
We have a browser session open with a tab for each Sprint member, this is saved as a browser session. When reopened the assignee defaults to the last assignee selected, in this case one is left with a bunch of open tabs for the same assignee. If one uses a tab reloader when each tab is activated then the assignee just keeps bouncing to the last selected on a tab.

So, currently the url includes, e.g.
type=TB&selectedProjectId=10345&selectedBoardId=10469&start=0n

Can the web service be updated to include an assignee reference in the URL to avoids this happening?
fields.summary: Task board - add the assignee to the url
